Package ohos.wifi

Class WifiLinkedInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.wifi.WifiLinkedInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public final class WifiLinkedInfo
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Provides information about a Wi-Fi connection.

    The information includes the SSID, BSSID, and RSSI.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      • getBssid

        public String getBssid​()
        Obtains the BSSID of a Wi-Fi access point.

        The BSSID is in XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX format.

        If you have no permission to obtain the BSSID, 02:00:00:00:00:00 is returned.

        Returns:
        Returns the BSSID of the Wi-Fi access point; returns null if no BSSID is found.
        Since:
        1

      • getRssi

        public int getRssi​()
        Obtains the RSSI of a Wi-Fi access point.

        The unit of RSSI is dBm.

        Returns:
        Returns the RSSI of the Wi-Fi access point.
        Since:
        1

      • getFrequency

        public int getFrequency​()
        Obtains the frequency of a Wi-Fi access point.
        Returns:
        Returns the frequency of the Wi-Fi access point.
        Since:
        1

      • getSsid

        public String getSsid​()
        Obtains the SSID of a Wi-Fi access point.

        The SSID is in UTF-8 format.

        Returns:
        Returns the SSID of the Wi-Fi access point.
        Since:
        1

      • getLinkSpeed

        public int getLinkSpeed​()
        Obtains the speed of a Wi-Fi access point.
        Returns:
        Returns the speed of the Wi-Fi access point.
        Since:
        1

      • getBand

        public int getBand​()
        Obtains the frequency band of a Wi-Fi access point.

        Two types of frequency bands are available: 2.4 GHz WifiEvents#BAND_WIFI_2G and 5 GHz WifiEvents#BAND_WIFI_5G.

        Returns:
        Returns the frequency band of the Wi-Fi access point; returns WifiEvents#BAND_INVALID if the frequency band is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • getMacAddress

        public String getMacAddress​()
        Obtains the Wi-Fi MAC address of a device.

        The MAC address is in XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX format.

        Returns:
        Returns the Wi-Fi MAC address of the device.
        Since:
        1

      • getIpAddress

        public int getIpAddress​()
        Obtains the IP address of this Wi-Fi connection.
        Returns:

      • getConnState

        public WifiLinkedInfo.ConnState getConnState​()
        Obtains the state of this Wi-Fi connection.
        Returns:
        Returns the state of this Wi-Fi connection. For the detailed states, see ConnState.
        Since:
        3

      • isHiddenSsid

        public boolean isHiddenSsid​()
        Checks whether the SSID of the access point (AP) of this Wi-Fi connection is hidden.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the SSID is hidden; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • isRestricted

        public boolean isRestricted​()
        Checks whether this Wi-Fi connection restricts the data volume.

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Description copied from class: Object
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.
